title: Strengthening Patient Care Practical Skills: Activity-Based Math Concept Learning: Abstract Thinking Using Manipulatives

context.prior_knowledge: Basic arithmetic skills and experience solving everyday problems
context.additional_context: Practical competency enhancement program for medical/nursing field practitioners

learning_goals: Learners can concretize fraction concepts using manipulatives and apply them to real-world scenarios (e.g., time calculation, medication distribution).
Learners can explain the process of transforming patterns discovered through physical manipulative activities into mathematical symbols (equations, graphs).
Learners can reconstruct abstract mathematical concepts into verifiable logical structures through collaborative activities with peers.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
